page.title: 12Mining the area
page.content: { Sir Alfred Hickman}was one of the chief landowners of Stockingford. He explored for coal and opened{'The Old {Pit'}near Stockingford Station. The shaft and winding wheel can still be seen. This gave employment to a great number of men near their own homes. The firm of{Stanley's}also had a pit nearby. Both pits had trouble with {flooding}meaning constant use of pumps.One was closed and an automatic pump installed in the other.In 1912 another shaft was opened,{Tunnel Pit. These worked until 1967.In 1887, {Chapel End Pit}was closed due to flooding.{Ansley Hall Pit}(owned by J. Phillips, grandfather of{Mark {Phillips,}until{Nationalisation}) closed. Houses for{Scottish miners}were built along Ansley Road, now part of Grove Farm Estate.
